#!/bin/bash
# Backup script - run daily by cron as root

BACKUP_SRC="/home/user/data"
BACKUP_DEST="/var/backups/user_backup_$(date +%Y%m%d).tar.gz"

tar -czf "$BACKUP_DEST" -C "$BACKUP_SRC" .
chown root:root "$BACKUP_DEST"
chmod 600 "$BACKUP_DEST"

# Notify admin
echo "Backup completed: $BACKUP_DEST" | mail -s "Backup Report" admin@example.com

# Clean up backups older than 7 days
find /var/backups/ -name 'user_backup_*.tar.gz' -mtime +7 -exec rm {} \;

#!/bin/bash
# Maintenance script run daily by cron as root

# Rotate logs
logrotate /etc/logrotate.conf

# Clean temporary directories
rm -rf /tmp/maintenance_tmp/*

# Run system updates
apt-get update && apt-get upgrade -y

# Check disk space and email if low
DISK_THRESHOLD=90
USAGE=$(df / | tail -1 | awk '{print $5}' | sed 's/%//')
